meta.title: Korean Peninsula Destiny
meta.description: The Shrimp Between Whales. A divided nation that became a flashpoint for global powers.
meta.historical_context: In 1945, after 35 years of Japanese occupation, Korea was liberated but immediately divided by the US and Soviet Union. This division led to a devastating war in 1950 and a 70-year standoff. But what if decisions made in those critical early years had been different?

neutral-korea.title: The Fortress of the East
neutral-korea.description: Korea unifies as a heavily armed neutral power. A 'porcupine' state that no great power dares to touch.
neutral-korea.divergence_description: US and Soviets agree to a unified trusteeship government.
neutral-korea.present_day_status: Korea is a fortress of neutrality. Every citizen is a soldier, but no war is fought. Seoul is the diplomatic capital of Asia. üïäÔ∏èüõ°Ô∏è

unified-election.title: The Great Election
unified-election.description: A coalition government is formed. Foreign troops leave.

no-cold-war-hot-war.consequence: Cold War remains colder. China focuses on development earlier.

red-korea.title: The Red Peninsula
red-korea.description: North Korea conquers the South in 1950, creating a unified communist state.
red-korea.divergence_description: US intervention fails and Pusan collapses.
red-korea.present_day_status: The United Republic of Korea is a militarized industrial giant and nuclear superpower. üéµüõë

fall-of-pusan.title: Fall of Pusan
fall-of-pusan.description: The KPA pushes the US into the sea.

japan-remilitarized.consequence: Japan becomes a nuclear power to deter Korea

blue-korea.title: The Miracle on the Han
blue-korea.description: The UN forces unite the peninsula in 1951, leading to a unified democratic powerhouse.
blue-korea.divergence_description: China does not intervene, allowing UN victory.
blue-korea.present_day_status: Korea is the 3rd largest economy in the world. Pyongyang is a tech hub known as 'Silicon Valley of the North'. üååüíª

yalu-victory.title: Christmas Home
yalu-victory.description: UN forces secure the border. China stays out.

g7-power.long_term: Korea becomes a G7 economy by 1990
g7-power.global_impact: Strong US ally on China's border

liberal-china.consequence: Pressure for reform in China accelerates

kim-il-sung.name: Kim Il-sung
kim-il-sung.description: Guerrilla leader turned dictator. Founder of North Korea.

syngman-rhee.name: Syngman Rhee
syngman-rhee.description: Stubborn nationalist who led South Korea through its darkest hour.

douglas-macarthur.name: Douglas MacArthur
douglas-macarthur.description: Supreme Commander who wanted to use nukes to win the war.

liberation-1945.title: The Division (1945)
liberation-1945.text: Japan has surrendered. The US and Soviets are drawing a line at the 38th parallel. You are a Korean independence leader. What do you advocate?

trusteeship.text: Accept trusteeship. Work for unified elections.
trusteeship.consequence: Hard negotiations, but it prevents the split.

separate-gov.text: Reject trusteeship. Establish a government in the South NOW.
separate-gov.consequence: The division solidifies. The North does the same.

korean-war-start.title: The Invasion (1950)
korean-war-start.text: June 25, 1950. Northern tanks are crossing the border. Seoul is falling. The US is deciding whether to intervene.

inchon.text: Organize a risky amphibious landing at Inchon.
inchon.consequence: It works! The North is cut off. We push to the North.

retreat.text: Hold the Pusan perimeter. Wait for reinforcements.
retreat.consequence: We hold, but the counter-attack is slow.

collapse.text: Evacuate to Japan. The position is lost.
collapse.consequence: The peninsula is lost. The Red Flag flies over Pusan.

china-intervention.title: The Yalu River (1950)
china-intervention.text: We have reached the Chinese border. Intelligence says 300,000 Chinese troops are waiting. MacArthur wants to bomb the bridges.

halt.text: Halt the advance. Dig in at the narrow neck.
halt.consequence: China feels safe and does not invade. We keep 90% of Korea.

attack.consequence: Disaster. The Chinese trap us. We are pushed back to the 38th parallel.

nukes.consequence: We win the war, but at what cost? WW3 begins.

axe-murder-incident.title: Operation Paul Bunyan (1976)
axe-murder-incident.text: It is 1976. Two US officers were killed by North Koreans while trimming a tree in the DMZ. The US military is furious. DEFCON 3.

show-force.text: Cut the tree down with massive overwhelming force. Do not shoot.
show-force.consequence: The North backs down. Historical timeline preserved.

airstrike.text: Launch an airstrike on the KPA barracks.
airstrike.consequence: War erupts again. China is too weak to help the North this time.

withdraw.text: Pull back troops to avoid escalation.
withdraw.consequence: The North sees this as weakness and ramps up aggression.

nuclear-crisis-1994.title: The Nuclear Crisis (1994)
nuclear-crisis-1994.text: North Korea is threatening to withdraw from the NPT and process plutonium. The Pentagon has drawn up plans for a strike on Yongbyon.

carter-deal.text: Send Jimmy Carter to negotiate a freeze (Agreed Framework).
carter-deal.consequence: Crisis averted for now. They will likely cheat later.

strike.text: Execute the surgical strike on the reactor.
strike.consequence: The reactor is destroyed, but Seoul is shelled. 2nd Korean War begins.

coup-plot.text: Fund a military coup against the leadership.
coup-plot.consequence: High risk. If it works, we get a neutral state.
